message.entry: Specify the color as an RGB triplet, a character vector, or a string scalar.
Specify colors as a three-column matrix of RGB triplets, a character vector, a cell-array of character vectors, or a string array.

''{0}'' is not a valid color specification. Valid names include: 'red', 'green', 'blue', 'cyan', 'magenta', 'yellow', 'black', and 'white'. Valid hexadecimal color codes consist of '#' followed by three or six hexadecimal digits.
Specify colors using a 1-D cell-array of character vectors or a 1-D string array.
Specify colors as a three-column matrix.
Specify the color as a three-element row vector.
Specify double or single values in the range [0, 1].
Specify one color specification or use the 'multiple' option.

Specify each hexadecimal color code as a hash symbol, "#", followed by three or six hexadecimal digits. For one color, specify the hexadecimal color code as string scalar or character vector. For multiple colors, use a string array or cell array of character vectors.
Specify RGB values as an m-by-3 or m-by-n-by-3 matrix.
Specify hexadecimal values as a string scalar, character vector, string array, or cell array of character vectors.
